Articles.Content:
ROCKETS

Rocket One: Three stages. The first are the six radial tank columns, the second stage is the middle tank column, and the final stage is the lander. I have updated it, and the lander should be more stable under ASAS control.

PLANES

Bi-plane One: A easy to fly, and reliable bi-plane. It will take off at around 65m/s, and it is perfectly stable while turning.

Kerbal Airliner: A large, conventionally designed plane, that can still take off on the runway. It has almost too much lift for it\'s own good.

Troop Transport: A large plane that is capable of dropping four Kerbals from wing mounted pods. You will need a (provided) mod part to do so, and you will need to manually load the Kerbals into the pods. It should also be noted that, if you go farther than 2.5 KM away from the pods, they will (if still in the air) disappear.

VTOLS

Cargo VTOL: A sleek VTOL capable of transporting cargo. It has under-wing engines for increased speed, and an ASAS module for safety.

ClawCraft: An odd VTOL, that is based off of a neat Star Wars ship I found.

BUILDINGS

Building: The first and second floors are the only Kerbal accessible floors, so this building is more designed as a large target. Well, all my buildings were built for crashing into...

Building2: A fully traversable, eight-story tall building. The outer section is only accessible by crashing a plane climbing to the top of the building via the internal ladders, and walking down the ladder that leads to the outer section. NOTE: My computer (Q8200 Quad-core w/ GTX-580) can\'t even run this building past .3 FPS.

Building3: The four-story tall version of Building2. My computer can actually run this (by run, I mean I can fly a plane into it).
That\'s quite an unusual biplane you have there.
Can you give me some flight instructions/tips for these? The biplane flips out of control when I try to turn it and the Cargo VTOL flips backward even with the main engines engaged.

Can you give me some flight instructions/tips for these? The biplane flips out of control when I try to turn it and the Cargo VTOL flips backward even with the main engines engaged.

Try and keep the bi-plane at low throttle at first, that might help with the flipping.

As for the VTOL, you could try and turn ASAS on before you lift off. One of the weird aspects of VTOLs is that if you are going <5 m/s, the VTOL becomes very unstable.
